subject: Send OCC mode change and IPS parms after reaching active state
commitMessage:
Send OCC mode change and IPS parms after reaching active state

Change is only applicable for POWER10 PowerVM systems.
Send mode change requests to OCC when PowerMode is changed.
Retry OCC command once, if a valid response is not received.

Tested: built openpower-occ-control successfully and verified
functionality on hardware.

Change-Id: If375f8abfdb2ad82937b8744096c2ccc471263d2
Signed-off-by: Chris Cain <cjcain@us.ibm.com>

why did you choose this over AC_ARG_ENABLE that others use?  From the documentation I guess it does look like they are handled exactly the same.
I had just copied it from host-communication-protocol, I will change to AC_ARG_ENABLE.

this is between the class doxygen and the class definition.  maybe move it up above line 25?  Also I guess adding its own doyxgen would be good.

Also, it's better to pass the string as a reference.
Done
if possible also check for PowerVM and only send if PowerVM.  This information is in the OCC poll response.
Done
I thought OEM was for our non-user interface modes i.e. FFO and Fmax.  Dynamic Performance should be its own string (granted not supported first GA)
This was more for testing, I can remove until we actually add Balanced / aka Dyname support

This doesn't necessarily indicate if the system booted in opal mode, but rather if the next boot is in OPAL mode. An external user would have to change this, but theoretically it can tell you the wrong thing.  Maybe since we don't support OPAL mode outside of the lab if it gives the wrong answer then it isn't that big of a deal?

We just want to prevent the user interface from allowing a mode change when the system is not in PowerVM mode.  Since this interface is not tied to the UI and the fact that there is currently no support for OPAL mode, I think this basic check is sufficient.
Ack
spelling
